thread.title: Your dogs at polling stations photos in Durham, Northumberland and North Tyneside
thread.title_full: Your dogs at polling stations photos in Durham, Northumberland and North Tyneside

author: Lesley Oldfield
title: Your dogs at polling stations photos in Durham, Northumberland and North Tyneside
text:
Your dogs at polling stations photos in Durham, Northumberland and North Tyneside Send your photos showing a lighter side to the local elections in the North East Share Alan Patrickson tweeted: "Rusty goes early at Durham" #dogsatpollingstations "An important day for many communities up and down the country, yes, it's #dogsatpollingstations day." (Photo: UGC TNE) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Polling days now have a lighter side thank to the Twitter hashtag #dogsatpollingstations which now seems to trend all day during any kind of elections. 
Have you taken a photograph of your dog at a polling station today? Do send it in telling us their name and where they were by emailing community@ncjmedia.co.uk Read More 
Meet a couple of hounds whose owners have already cast their vote and posted on the hashtag. Weimaraner Murphy waits in North Tyneside below. Owner Sarah Jeffery tweeted: "Murphy wasn't very keen on voting" #dogsatpollingstations (Photo: UGC TNE) 
And Alan Patrickson tweeted: "Rusty goes early at Durham" #dogsatpollingstations "An important day for many communities up and down the country, yes, it's #dogsatpollingstations day." (Photo: UGC TNE) Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Pensioner confronts Tim Farron during campaign visit Share this video Watch Next 
The last time the hashtag trended was during the EU referendum,, when Mary Shaw was among the first in the region to tweet from Gosforth’s All Saints Church Hall polling station in Newcastle. 
Solicitor Mary said: “Marv the Lurcher was up early today and got a warm welcome. His full name is MarvIN ...” Marv the lurcher tweeted by Mary Shaw from Gosforth on the hashtag #dogsatpollingstations 
On that day, as today at least they have had a nice sunny day to be waiting outside. Mind you, Marv got a great welcome inside too! 
Here's Finn. Vicki Deritis @Cutofherjib tweeted: "FINn is worried about what Brexit could mean for both the economy and his EU pet passport." #dogsatpollingstations Vicki Deritis @Cutofherjib tweeted: "FINn is worried about what Brexit could mean for both the economy and his EU pet passport." 
And Mito was out too, as you can see. Owner Laura Johnson @laurathwench tweeted: "Mito helping me vote in sunny Stanley." Laura Johnson @laurathwench tweeted: "Mito helping me vote in sunny Stanley." 
Robin Son said: "Drax has just been and had his say in Heaton." Voter Robin Son @geekuneek took Drax along 
Paul Graham @PaulGrahamPharm said: "Ahh, thank goodness they've voted and we can relax." Paul Graham's dog has done his bit for #dogsatpollingstations 
Follow us on Twitter @chroniclelive - the official Chronicle Twitter account - real news in real time. 
We’re also on Facebook/NewcastleChronicle - your must-see news, features, videos and pictures throughout the day from the Chronicle. Like us on Facebook
